intro: Crepidomanes agasthianum, commonly known as the Agasthian mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and hairy, while its stems are erect and branching. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
